TopicTitle: UNSC Infinity - More of a Work In Progress And Input Needed

Articles.Content:
One of ONI's black projects. Major changes have occurred to both the ships and frigates since this post to increase ship length to about 2.2 km.

The Infinity is also progressing along. This is just the bottom section for the frigates.

Edited May 27, 2014 by andrew123

Is the ship seriously 2.2 km so far? My Kod that's big. Wonder if you'll be able to see the whole thing from the bridge.. nothing like bumping a station without even realizing it, then later finding out you destroyed the entire front of the ship in the process, just what you needed with such a big ship... Lel. But seriously, can your computer handle that? Or do we need to overclock Squad to update KSP to x64?

Good luck with this monster.
Maybe we can start ramming other ships after coming out of slipspace. I believe that squad should wait on optimizing until at least the beta stage in order to focus its resources more effectively.

It should have ODST's! Half of its size would be bit more practical though.

Edited April 11, 2014 by Hawkins65
Not sure if this project is possible. If you manage it however even Whackjob will be in awe!

Load range is 2.5 km, so this is possible.

Good luck with your meta-Whackjobian endavour, my good man! Kerbin be with you!

I think...

THAT THIS IS AWESOME!
What happens if a ship is larger than the load range?
O_o indeed. I don't even know what I'm looking at. But it looks big.

I do plan on putting in an insane amount of these odst pods. I already fielded them in my charon and paris class specialist frigates.

I can already hear The CPU god chanting... SILICON FOR THE CPU GOD! RAM FOR THE RAM THRONE!

Edited April 25, 2014 by Hawkins65
Misspelling
NASA called - they wanted their supercomputer back. Expected frame rate: .001-(300^9*1.7) FPS...
I do hope you are using part welding. Otherwise your PC will commit suicide... by combusting...

Don't worry guys. I'm pretty sure this amd fx 6300 vishera with technically 3 cores and weak individual thread performance will handle my ship just fine. I mean, my old laptop cpu was a more powerful i7 and wouldn't handled even my other creations well.

I expect San Diego to have a new crater soon. I just hope my craft file will escape vaporization.

Edited June 6, 2014 by BlackHoleSun

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/82118-KSP-64bits-on-Windows-%28this-time-it-s-not-a-request%29

What was that about the ram limit again? 64 bit windows programs to the rescue.

I realize that this creation will probably crash my computer multiple times. I'll try making it as large as I can, wait for more headroom to be added into the game, then improve the design.

PS: I was a ksp player long before the steam release. I also don't intend to stir negative feelings.

Plus, "buff"? I believe you should ninja edit that to bluff.

If not, thank you. XD

Are you part of the pre 0.16 "master race"? I would rather not have ksp users segment ourselves like the computer and console players.

I have plenty of science missions on my record. If you think KSP should never be used for anything resembling "child play", remember that we each payed for it to do as we please.

Also, I have plenty of experience with gigantic ships. Do you consider whackjob as the avatar of all that is unholy in this new ksp userbase?
